snippet: Nations afflicted by the epidemic, as well as their neighbors, will need to redouble efforts to contain the virus.
abstract: Editorial warns West African nations Guinea and Sierra Leone, which are afflicted with the deadly Ebola virus, and their neighboring countries need to redouble their efforts to contain the outbreak; holds outbreaks will require large education effort to alert people to the dangers of the virus and ways to avoid becoming infected.
lead_paragraph: Nations afflicted by the epidemic, as well as their neighbors, will need to redouble efforts to contain the virus.

headline.main: Ebola Gets Worse in West Africa
headline.print_headline: Ebola Gets Worse in West Africa
